name: lib/add-to-array.specs.js
lib/composit-state.js
CompositState
description:
Class to build, parse and manipulate composit states
State object in FSM are converted to string using this class
The state object { a: 'val1', b: 'val2', c: 'val3' } is internaly stored
in its string repreentation: "a:val1|b:val2|c:val3" This utillity class is available from {@link FSM#compositState} property

name: build
description: Build a state string from a javascript object

return.description: the string representation of the object

name: parse
description: Build a state string from a javascript object

params.name: state
params.description: the string representation of the object

name: lib/composit-state.specs.js

lib/fsm.js
FSM
description: Class representing a Finite State Machine

name: compositState
description: Returns the composit state tool used to parse and build state strings from objects

name: toFunctionName
description: Create a camelCase function name formthe given string. Used internally to convert transition names to function names

return.description: camelCased version of the given name

params.name: options.initialState
params.description: the state string used to initialize the state machine

params.name: options.data
params.description: the data that is stored in the state machine

params.name: options.eventHandler
params.description:
object containin hander for specific trasaction
```
{
	beforeTransName: async (ctx, args) => {...},
	afterTransName: async (ctx, args) => {...},
}
```

params.name: options.api

name: init
description: Initalize an existing state machine with the given state

params.name: state
params.description:
the state string to set. The string must be one of the existing
states of the state machine

name: data
description: Get the data stored in the state machine

name: data
description: Set the data stored in the state machine

name: transitions
description: Get all transitions that are valid for the current state of the state machine

name: allTransitions
description:
Get all transititons that are defined for the state machine in the format
```javascript
{
   t1: { from: 'a', to: 'b', ...},
   t2: { from: 'a', to: 'b', ...},
   t3: { from: 'a', to: 'b', ...},
}```

name: restApi

params.name: args
params.description: list of arguments passed to the event handlers during transition

return.description: object containing the results of the executed event handlers

name: addTransition
description: Add a new transition to the state machine

params.name: transition
params.description:
the name of the transition

Suported syntax: (camelCasle, colon:case, snake_case, dash-case)
myTransition, my:transition, my_transition, my-transition => will create function .myTransition()

params.name: transition.form
params.description:
the states from which this transition can be triggered.

Supported syntax: ``` '*' => allow from any state 'state1' => allow only from state 'state1' ['state1', 'state2'] => allow transition from state1 & state2 { state: ['s1', 's2'], substate: ['sub1', 'sub2'] } => allow transition from all states creates by calculating all permutations of the given states. 'state:s2|substate:sub1' 'state:s2|substate:sub1' and 'state:s2|substate:sub2' ```

params.name: transition.form
params.description:
defines the state that is created after the transition

Supported syntax: ```javascript '*' => do not change source state 'state1' => sets target state to 'state1' { state: 's1' } => sets the property "state" of the current state to "s1" eg. patches the existing state object representation ```

params.name: args
params.description: the arguments that will be passed to event handlers

return.description: contains the result objects from the event handlers
